dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1.3497

enttyp.enttypd: Census block groups are units of US census geography. The polygons used are based on Census 2010 boundaries.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Block group FIPS code in string format
5-digit identification code for containing core-based statistical area (metropolitan region)
Name of the core based statistical area (or metropolitan region) in which block group resides.
Block group FIPS code in integer format
An index of relative accessibilitycompared to other block groups within the same metro region, as measured by travel time to working-age population via transit.
Total population able to access the block group within a 45-minute transit and walking commute
Total population able to access the block group within a 45-minute transit and walking commute as a percentage of total regional population.
Employed population able to access the block group within a 45-minute transit commute from their home location.
Employed population able to access the block group within a 45-minute transit commute from their home location as a percentage of total regional employed population.
Number of low wage workers (those earning $1250/month or less) that can reach the block group within a 45 minute transit commute
Low- and medium-waege workers (those earning $3,333/month or less) that can reach the block group within a 45-minute transit commute from their home location.
Low-wage workers that can reach the block group within a 45-minute transit commute from their home location as a percentage of all low-wage workers in region.
Low- and medium-wage workers that can reach the block group within a 45-minute transit commute from their home location as a percentage of all low- and medium-wage workers in region.
Total jobs reachable within a 45-minute transit and walking commute
Total jobs reachable within a 45-minute transit and walking commute as a percentage of total regional jobs
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

descript.abstract: A collection of performance indicators and regional benchmarks for consistently comparing neighborhoods (census block groups) across the US in regards to their accessibility to jobs or workers via public transit service. Accessibility was modeled by calculating total travel time between block group centroids inclusive of walking to/from transit stops, wait times, and transfers. Block groups that can be accessed in 45 minutes or less from the origin block group are considered accessible. Indicators reflect public transit service in December 2012 and employment/worker counts in 2010. Coverage is limited to census block groups within metropolitan regions served by transit agencies who share their service data in a standardized format called GTFS.
descript.purpose: An employer or business may use this data to identify neighborhoods that have high transit accessibility to the regional population or workforce. In other words, it may use the data to identify locations that are easy to reach via transit for the greatest possible number of residents or potential workers. Such information can be valuable to facility siting decisions. Similarly this data can be used to identify residential locations that have high accessibility to jobs by transit. Regional benchmarks provide comparisons to better understand the performance of a block group compared to the best or average performance among all block groups in the surrounding metropolitan region.

citeinfo.title: Access to Jobs and Workers via Transit - Service

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of the Administrator (OA) - Office of Policy (OP)
